name: Analog-to-digital Converter (ADC) 2 and Touch Key Detection (TKEY) 2 registers

AWD.name: Analog watchdog flag bit

values.1: The analog watchdog event occurs.

AWD.comment: This bit is set to 1 by hardware (the conversion value is out of the ADC_WDHTR and ADC_WDLTR register range), and is cleared by software (invalid if writing 1).

EOC.name: Conversion completion status

values.1: The conversion has completed.

EOC.comment: This bit is set to 1 by hardware (the regular or injected channel group conversion ends), and is cleared by software (invalid if writing 1) or clearing when ADC_RDATAR is read.

JEOC.name: Injected channel group conversion completion status

values.1: The conversion has completed.

JEOC.comment: This bit is set to 1 by hardware (the conversion of all injected channels is completed), and cleared by software (invalid if writing 1).

JSTRT.name: Injected channel conversion start status

values.1: The injected channel conversion has started.
values.0: The injected channel conversion has not started.

JSTRT.comment: This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (invalid if writing 1).

STRT.name: Regular channel conversion start status

values.1: The regular channel conversion has started.
values.0: The regular channel conversion has not started.

STRT.comment: This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (invalid if writing 1).

EOCIE.name: Conversion completion (regular or injected channel group) interrupt enable bit

values.1: Enable the transfer completion bit (EOC flag).

AWDIE.name: Analog watchdog interrupt enable bit

values.1: Enable analog watchdog interrupt.

AWDIE.comment: In scan mode, if this interrupt occurs, the scan will be aborted.

JEOCIE.name: Injected channel group conversion completion interrupt enable bit

values.1: Enable injected channel group transfer completion interrupt (IEOC flag).
values.0: Disable injected channel group transfer completion interrupt.

values.1: Enable scan mode (continuous conversion of all channels selected by ADC_IOFRx and ADC_RSQRx).

AWDSGL.name: In scan mode, analog watchdog enable bit on a single channel

values.1: Enable analog watchdog on single channel (AWDCH[4:0] selection).
values.0: Disable analog watchdog on all channels.

JAUTO.name: After regular channel is enabled, automatically injected channel group conversion enable bit

values.1: Enable automatic injected channel group conversion.
values.0: Disable automatic injected channel group conversion.

JAUTO.comment: The external trigger function of the injected channel needs to be disabled in this mode.

DISCEN.name: Discontinuous mode enable bit on the regular channel

values.1: Enable discontinuous mode on the regular channel.
values.0: Disable discontinuous mode on the regular channel.

JDISCEN.name: Discontinuous mode enable bit on injected channel

values.1: Enable discontinuous mode on the injected channel.
values.0: Disable discontinuous mode on the injected channel.

DISCNUM.name: In discontinuous mode, the number of regular channels to be converted after external trigger

DUALMOD.name: Dual mode selection

values.0001: Regular simultaneous mode + Injected simultaneous mode
values.0010: Regular simultaneous mode + Alternate trigger mode
values.0011: Injected simultaneous mode + Fast interleaved mode
values.0100: Injected simultaneous mode + Slow interleaved mode

DUALMOD.comment: Modification of a configuration bit must be performed when dual mode is disabled.

JAWDEN.name: Analog watchdog enable bit on injected channels

values.1: Enable analog watchdog on injected channels.
values.0: Disable analog watchdog on injected channels.

AWDEN.name: Analog watchdog enable bit on regular channels

values.1: Enable analog watchdog on regular channels.
values.0: Disable analog watchdog on regular channels.

TKEYEN.name: TKEY module enable control, including TKEY_F and TKEY_V units

values.1: Enable TKEY module.
Charging current is reduced half.

BUFEN.name: ADC BUFFER enable

values.1: Buffer input enabled.

BUFEN.comment:
Cases where buffer needs to be turned on:
1. When TKENABLE bit or TSVREFE position 1, buffer is on by default and cannot be turned off (so in these two cases, ADC calibration needs to be before TKENABLE bit or TSVREFE position 1 and buffer needs to be turned off).
2. When the external input impedance is greater than the maximum input impedance requirement, the buffer can be turned on to improve the ADC acquisition data (at this time, the ADC sampling time is not recommended to be less than 7.5T), the external input impedance is detailed in CH32F203DS0 / CH32F208DS0 / CH32V203DS0 / CH32V208DS0 datasheet Table 4-28; CH32V307DS0 / CH32F207DS0 datasheet Table 4-41.
Refer to EVT related routines for specific operation.

PGA.name: ADC channel gain configuration
PGA.comment: The input gain can be configured, for amplifying small signals and sampling. ADC_Buffer needs to be enabled to use this function.

ADON.name: A/D converter ON/OFF

values.1: Enable ADC and to start conversion.
values.0: Disable ADC conversion/calibration, and go to power down mode.

ADON.comment:
When this bit is 0, writing 1 will wake up the ADC from power-down mode; when this bit is 1, writing 1 will start the conversion.
When only ADON changes in the register, a conversion will be started. If any other bits are sent to change, a new conversion will not be started.

CONT.name: Continuous conversion enable

values.1: Continuous conversion mode.

CONT.comment: If this bit is set, the conversion will continue until the bit is cleared.

CAL.name: A/D calibration, set by software and cleared by hardware when the calibration is completed

values.1: Enable the calibration.

RSTCAL.name: Reset calibration, this bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after reset

values.1: Initialize calibration register.

RSTCAL.comment: If RSTCAL is set while the conversion is in progress, it takes extra cycles to clear the calibration register.

values.1: Enable DMA mode.
Left alignment.

JEXTSEL.name: External trigger event select for injected channels

values.110: EXTI line 15 / CC4 event of timer 8

JEXTSEL.comment: Only high-density devices have CC4 event in timer 8.

JEXTTRIG.name: External trigger conversion mode enable for injected channels

values.1: Enable conversion on external event.

EXTSEL.name: External trigger event select for regular channel

values.110: EXTI line 11 / TRGO event of timer 8

EXTSEL.comment: Only high-density devices have TRGO event in timer 8.

EXTTRIG.name: External trigger conversion mode enable for regular channels

values.1: Enable conversion on external event.

JSWSTART.name: Start conversion of an injected channel, set by software to start

values.1: Start conversion of an injected channels.

JSWSTART.comment: This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware or software after the conversion starts.

SWSTART.name: Start conversion of a regular channel, set by software to start

values.1: Start conversion of a regular channel.

SWSTART.comment: This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the conversion starts.

TSVREFE.name: Temperature sensor and internal voltage (V_REFINT) channel enable

values.1: Enable the temperature sensor and V_REFINT channel.
values.0: Disable the temperature sensor and V_REFINT channel.

SAMPTR1_CHARGE1.name: ADC2 sample time configuration register 1 / TKEY2 charge sample time register 1

SMP10_TKCG10.name: Sample time configuration of channel 10 / Select the charge sample time of channel 10
SMP10_TKCG10.comment:
These bits are used to independently select the sample time of each channel, and the channel configuration value must remain unchanged during the sampling period.
These bits are used to independently select the charge time for each channel. Time base: ADC clock.

IOFR1.name: ADC2 injected channel data offset register 1

JOFFSET1.name: Data offset for injected channel 1
JOFFSET1.comment: When the injected channel is converted, these bits define the value to be subtracted from the original conversion data. The result of the conversion can be read in the ADC_IDATAR1 register.

IOFR2.name: ADC2 injected channel data offset register 2

JOFFSET2.name: Data offset for injected channel 2
JOFFSET2.comment: When the injected channel is converted, these bits define the value to be subtracted from the original conversion data. The result of the conversion can be read in the ADC_IDATAR2 register.

IOFR3.name: ADC2 injected channel data offset register 3

JOFFSET3.name: Data offset for injected channel 3
JOFFSET3.comment: When the injected channel is converted, these bits define the value to be subtracted from the original conversion data. The result of the conversion can be read in the ADC_IDATAR3 register.

IOFR4.name: ADC2 injected channel data offset register 4

JOFFSET4.name: Data offset for injected channel 4
JOFFSET4.comment: When the injected channel is converted, these bits define the value to be subtracted from the original conversion data. The result of the conversion can be read in the ADC_IDATAR4 register.

HT.name: Analog watchdog high threshold set bits

LT.name: Analog watchdog low threshold set bits

SQ13.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 13th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ14.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 14th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ15.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 15th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ16.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 16th converted channel in regular sequence

L.name: The quantity of channels to be converted in the regular channel conversion sequence

SQ7.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 7th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ8.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 8th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ9.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 9th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ10.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 10th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ11.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 11th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ12.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 12th converted channel in regular sequence

RSQR3_CHANNEL.name: ADC2 regular channel sequence register 3 / TKEY2 channel select register

SQ1_CHSEL.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 1st converted channel in regular sequence / TKEY_V channel select

SQ2.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 2nd converted channel in regular sequence

SQ3.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 3rd converted channel in regular sequence

SQ4.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 4th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ5.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 5th converted channel in regular sequence

SQ6.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 6th converted channel in regular sequence

JSQ1.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 1st converted channel in injected sequence

JSQ2.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 2nd converted channel in injected sequence

JSQ3.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 3rd converted channel in injected sequence

JSQ4.name: No. (0 to 17) of the 4th converted channel in injected sequence

JL.name: The quantity of channels to be converted in the injected channel conversion sequence

IDATAR1_CHGOFFSET.name: ADC2 injected data register 1 / TKEY2 charge time offset register

JDATA0_7_TKCGOFFSET.name: Injected channel converted data (data left alignment or right alignment) / TKEY charge time offset configuration value
JDATA0_7_TKCGOFFSET.comment:
Total charge time: TCHG = TKCGOFFSET + TKCGx
This register maps the injected data register 1 (ADC_IDATAR1) of the ADC module. So when write operation is performed on this address register, it serves as TKEY charge time offset (TKEY_CHGOFFSET). When read operation is performed, it serves as the injected data register 1 (ADC_IDATAR1) of the ADC module.

JDATA8_15.name: Injected channel converted data (data left alignment or right alignment)

JDATA.name: Injected channel converted data (data left alignment or right alignment)
Injected channel converted data (data left alignment or right alignment)
Injected channel converted data (data left alignment or right alignment)

RDATAR_DR_ACT_DCG.name: ADC2 regular data register / TKEY2 data register / TKEY2 activate and discharge time register

DATA0_7_TKACT_DCG.name: Regular channel converted data (data left or right alignment) / Write the discharge time and activate a TKEY channel detection

DATA8_15.name: Regular channel converted data (data left or right alignment)
